hints.MALARIA: Infectious, misfolded protein that causes healthy proteins to misfold, leading to fatal neurodegenerative diseases
hints.MICROGLIA: Brainâ€™s resident immune cells that protect neurons but can drive chronic inflammation in disease.
hints.INTEGRINS: Cell surface receptors that anchor cells to the extracellular matrix and relay mechanical signals inside.
hints.INFLAMMATION: A bodily response to infection or injury, often causing redness and swelling.
hints.ALLOSTASIS: The process of achieving stability through physiological or behavioral changes in response to stress.
hints.ASTROCYTES: Star-shaped support cells in the brain that nourish neurons, maintain homeostasis, and turn harmful when reactive in disease.
hints.HYPOXIA: Low oxygen zones inside tumors that trigger survival, angiogenesis, and therapy resistance.
hints.PARKINSON: A neurodegenerative disorder marked by tremors and dopamine depletion.
hints.ANGIOGENESIS: Formation of new blood vessels that feed tumors and support their growth and spread.
hints.VIRULENCE: The degree of pathogenicity or ability of a microbe to cause disease.
